TEXT.TITLE: S/P DOWNGRADES CANADA'S PROVINCE OF SASKATCHEWAN
TEXT.BODY: Standard and Poor's Corp said it downgraded Canada's Province of Saskatchewan. The action affects the equivalent of 1.68 billion U.S. dlrs of debt. S and P lowered the province's long-term debt to AA-minus from AA. The rating agency said the action reflected a substantial increase in Saskatchewan's budget deficit for fiscal 1987 and prospects for greater tax-supported debt in the medium term. S and P pointed out that the outlook for future revenue growth is constrained by general weakness in the province's commodity-based economy because of low prices. Reuter
